Detailed Description

A class holding the data related to a device. A device is mostly a container of nodes that share the same parent USB device. The DeviceServer class is in charge of the creation and desctruction of the NodeServer.

Member Function Documentation

void DepthSense::Core::DeviceServer::addNode ( NodeEvent *  nodeEvent,
bool  defaultDisableAutoConfigurationState = false 
)
protected

add a node to the vector of NodeServer. This will trigger the construction of a NodeServer based on the event data. If construction of a NodeServer fails, an UnsupportedNode will be constructed instead.

Parameters
nodeEventa pointer to the NodeEvent received from the DeviceEnumerator
defaultDisableAutoConfigurationStatewhether to disable the auto configuration or not by default (if applicable)
bool DepthSense::Core::DeviceServer::contains ( NodeServer *  node) const

whether a NodeServer is part of the DeviceServer

Parameters
nodea pointer of a NodeServer
Returns
whether the node is part of the DeviceServer
virtual void DepthSense::Core::DeviceServer::dispose ( )
protectedvirtual

dispose all resources related to this node. This method should be called prior to delete the object. This method will close and release the device

void DepthSense::Core::DeviceServer::insureAlive ( ) const
protected

Insure that the node is still alive. Throws an InvalidOperationException in case the node is disposed or disposing. Note that the _lock Mutex should be AutoLock before invoking this method

Parameters

void DepthSense::Core::DeviceServer::resumeVideoNodes ( )
protected

resume the streaming of all the running video NodeServer. Used on Linux to work around video streaming freeze when the audio node is started.
